title: What is Java?
answers: An operating system
A programming language
A database management system
A hardware device

title: What is the difference between JDK and JRE?
answers: JDK includes JRE and development tools, while JRE only includes the Java Runtime Environment
JDK is used for running Java applications, while JRE is used for developing Java applications
JDK is used for developing Java applications, while JRE is used for running Java applications
There is no difference between JDK and JRE
right_answer: JDK includes JRE and development tools, while JRE only includes the Java Runtime Environment

title: What is an object in Java?
answers: An instance of a class
A variable
A keyword
A data type

title: What is inheritance in Java?
answers: The ability of a class to inherit properties and methods from another class
The ability of a class to hide properties and methods from other classes
The ability of a class to create instances of other classes
The ability of a class to modify the behavior of other classes
right_answer: The ability of a class to inherit properties and methods from another class

title: What is a constructor in Java?
answers: A method that is used to destroy objects
A method that is used to access objects
A method that is used to modify objects
A special method that is used to create and initialize objects
right_answer: A special method that is used to create and initialize objects

title: What is polymorphism in Java?
answers: The ability of a class to inherit properties and methods from another class
The ability of a class to hide properties and methods from other classes
The ability of a method to take many forms
The ability of a class to modify the behavior of other classes
right_answer: The ability of a method to take many forms

title: What is an interface in Java?
answers: A collection of concrete methods and variables
A collection of abstract methods and constants
A collection of static methods and constants
A collection of final methods and variables
right_answer: A collection of abstract methods and constants

title: What is a package in Java?
answers: A collection of related classes and interfaces
A collection of related methods and variables
A collection of related objects
A collection of related data types
right_answer: A collection of related classes and interfaces

title: What is a thread in Java?
answers: A data type
A lightweight process that runs concurrently with other threads
A method
A variable
right_answer: A lightweight process that runs concurrently with other threads

title: What is exception handling in Java?
answers: The process of preventing runtime errors from occurring
The process of debugging Java code
The process of optimizing Java code
The process of handling runtime errors gracefully
right_answer: The process of handling runtime errors gracefully
